q: Microsoft. Amitabh Srivastava joined in 1997 and started Project Red Dog in 2006, which became the Azure compute fabric. No reason was given for his exit, but Steve Ballmer said in his email about Satya Nadella 's appointment: Windows Azure is in a great place, and Amitabh Srivastava is ready to move to a new phase in his career. losing engineers frustrated by a shift in the culture that normally happens when a company gets as big as Google is,'' Seth Harris , technology practice head at Tim Cook Associates, told the E-Commerce Times. Engineers fear the company is not moving fast enough and say it's harder to get time with leaders; many have already made money with Google and see opportunities to move to big private tech firms expected to go public in 12 to 18 months. that the American`` X Factor'' would be open to contestants as young as 12 years old. Unlike`` American Idol,'' the competition is open to vocal groups as well as solo singers. Allen Iverson 's final two 3-pointers were the biggest of the game, coming after Philadelphia had pulled within 10 with 5:14 remaining. When[ Allen Iverson ] went on that run, it seemed like he was unstoppable, Allen Iverson said.`` He almost pulled it off.'' In an otherwise charming feature story posted on MLB.com about the charity work that he and his wife do for stray dogs, Mark Buehrle 's comments noticeably changed in tone when Michael Vick 's name came up. Even if you are not a dog lover, how can you sit there and make two dogs fight and one is going to die? said( Mark Buehrle ).`` How could you do that if you are somewhat sane? Then the fans returned the favor with raucous ovations he won't soon forget. That's when you get the goose bumps, Allen Iverson said.`` You honestly don't really feel it when the shots are going down. You don't ever get the goose bumps until the fans start to appreciate what you're doing out there.''
